title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch SXM-10 satellite for SiriusXM on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The SXM-10 satellite launch comes six months after the SXM-9 satellite was launched from Florida. SpaceX is targeting liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station on Friday, June 6 at 11:19 p.m. EDT (0319 UTC on June 7).

title: ispace’s Resilience lander crash lands on the Moon
summary: This was the second consecutive failed landing for the Japan-based company. A preliminary analysis points to issues with the laser altimeter.

title: A Second Lunar Landing Failure for ispace
summary: A second attempt by a Japanese company to land on the Moon failed today, two years after the first try.  In a post-landing press conference, the company, ispace, said they […]

title: Senate Committee Wants to Keep Gateway, SLS and Orion
summary: The Senate committee that oversees NASA released its proposal for the reconciliation bill today signaling support for NASA’s current Moon to Mars plan, not the Trump Administration’s version. The $10 […]

title: Second ispace lunar lander presumed lost
summary:
Resilience, the second mission by Japanese company ispace, likely crashed attempting a landing on the moon June 5.
The post Second ispace lunar lander presumed lost appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Senate response to White House budget for NASA: Keep SLS, nix science
Cruz seeks $10 billion for NASA programs in budget reconciliation bill
summary:
The chairman of the Senate Commerce Committee unveiled a proposal to add $10 billion to a budget reconciliation bill to offset cuts to NASA human spaceflight and exploration programs.
The post Cruz seeks $10 billion for NASA programs in budget reconciliation bill appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: HASC warns White House over delayed defense budget, potential cuts to Space Force funding
summary:
Rep. Mike Rogers (R-Ala.) said the delays are "not helpful" and could force Congress to act unilaterally on defense spending.

title: Senators unveil bipartisan bill to boost space cooperation with Indo-Pacific allies
summary:
Sen. Michael Bennet (D-Colo.), a member of the Senate Intelligence Committee, and Sen. Kevin Cramer (R-N.D.), who sits on the Armed Services Committee, introduced the Quad Space Act
